intro: Clomenocoma speciosa, commonly known as the showy milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. Clomenocoma speciosa plays a vital role in supporting local pollinators, including butterflies and bees.
